page.title: 06HOUSING - SULLINGTON
page.content: Housing in the Sullington area is very scattered and varies from ancient stone and flint cottages, through Georgian and Victorian buildings, to modern brick built houses. The majority are owner occupied with large attractive gardens. There are a number of farmhouses, but few tied cottages. Several of the older properties are said to have been connected with the smuggling trade of the last century. Others, such as the limeburners' cottages, have been converted to large private residences. Part of the Council housing estates of Meadowside and Postview encroach on the Northern boundary of this area.
